# item(at:)

**Instance Method**

Returns the menu item at a specific location of the menu.

## Declaration

```swift
func item(at index: Int) -> NSMenuItem?
```

## Parameters

- **index**: An integer index locating a menu item in a menu.

## Return Value

The found menu item (an object conforming to the NSMenuItem protocol) or `nil` if the object couldn’t be found.

## Discussion

This method raises an exception if `index` is out of bounds.

## Related Documentation

- **index(of:)**: Returns the index identifying the location of a specified menu item in the menu.

## Finding Menu Items

- **item(withTag:)**: Returns the first menu item in the menu with the specified tag.
- **item(withTitle:)**: Returns the first menu item in the menu with a specified title.
- **numberOfItems**: The number of menu items in the menu, including separator items.
- **items**: An array containing the menu items in the menu.
